intro: Tarrietia erythrosiphon var. antsiranensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starwort, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinctive reddish hue, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine.
